title: Thunderbird has trashed my Folders
content:
I used to be able to drag an email to a folder. Now I get a circle with a line in it, and my folders are all messed up. For example, Woodworking used to be a folder by itself. Now it is a sub-folder of Retire. Many other similar folders are messed up. Is there any way to recover? How can I move Woodworking to be a folder by itself, not under Retire. I have rebooted. No help.

Windows 7, Thunderbird is up to date.
creator: jambe

title: Duplication of Inbox and folders
content:
Hi, I recently had to reset my pc and reinstall all applications including Thunderbird. The following were the steps I took after Thunderbird was reinstalled: 1. I then copied my profile data from a data backup to my laptop into C:>Users>username>AppData>Roaming>Thunderbird>Profiles using internet explorer. 2. I then changed my Thunderbird Account settings to use my original profile in Server settings under Local Directory. 3. At the same time I also changed my mail server from imap.bigpond.com to imap.telstra.com however it still recorded the server type as POP Mail Server.

When Thunderbird application restarted after the above changes, I noticed in the Mail Folder display that my Inbox folders had duplicated along with Deleted, Trash, Draft, Archive & Sent folders e.g. it showed Inbox and relevant sub folders and INBOX-1 with the same relevant sub-folders. Some of the sub folders in Inbox were missing stored emails and these were found under the INBOX-1 subfolder. Also under the Local Folders section it also displayed current emails under the Inbox folder which are recorded in the Mail Inbox folder. So not knowing why this occurred or to resolve, I decided to uninstall Thunderbird and then download it again. By doing this, it has fixed the display issues mentioned above in the Thunderbird application but I still have duplicated Inbox, Sent, Deleted & Archives on my laptop under my Thunderbird profile folders. So my query is....do I attempt to move the data from the duplicated folders to the main folders or just leave it as is seeing it appears to be working?
creator: Rosalie.Connarty

title: Message filters - 'From' field
content:
The 'From' field in email messages includes a display name and an email address - really 2 separate pieces of information, yet the message filters don't seem to have a mechanism to specify one or the other. I'd like to add a filter to look only at the display name... Is there a way to do this?

Thanks,
creator: kvon

title: No Interest in Browsing Your Ill-Designed Forums (again, again):  No Profile Creation for Windows 11
content:
Long-time user (and contributor) to Mozilla. Very unhappy with migration from Windows 10 machine to a new Windows 11 machine for Thunderbird. Despite all attempts, Thunderbird would not create a profile (of any type) recognizable in file explorer under the appropriate folders (yes, I know what I'm doing).

Ultimately, I created a "fake" Thunderbird/profiles folder set and then transferred (via a flash drive) to the new Thunderbird installation using the profiles manager.

Your website was of no help in this process.

Sadly, it seems about a quadrillion subscribers have the same problem.

Apparently, you have a BIG problem with migration to Windows 11.

Al Smith (looking for a better solution than Thunderbird)
creator: tnhiker865

title: Deleted File for emails.
content: My Thunderbird used to have a Deleted File for emails,so if I accidently deleted an email,it could be rescued.I am an 85 year old strokie and my hand sometimes manages to click twice on the deleted button.I've re-installed Thunderbird,have Deleted Files in Local Folders and Home Account,but not in my regular email section,but deleted emails are not in either of these two folders,so what can I do please?
creator: rod.willmott

title: T-bird "blew-up"
content:
I'll admit that I had too much stuff in my Thunderbird - saved emails, spam builds up fast, maybe didn't clean out my incoming enough, etc.

But About once a week I delete my junk and spam and then empty trash. Last night I emptied trash as usual, and T-bird cleaned out almost everything—much of my incoming, and most of all the emails I had saved in sub-folders.

I'm working on settling my brain down from that, but meanwhile my sent emails aren't copying to the sent folder, and when I accidently delete an incoming email, it doesn't revert back with a command-z.

Obviously I'm quite nervous, and wondering where do I go from here?

Thank you!
creator: chipborkenhagen

I need to keep the old account in Tbird as it holds archive emails for many years.

title: I'm no longer offered the option to use FILELINK
content:
3/30/2025 FILELINK NOT OFFERED 

  Recently when sending a large file, I was offered the option to use  FILELINK. I don’t remember the exact message text, but I believe it was a  simple “Yes/No”.   I responded “No” and I got another message offering a choice to never ask about FILELINK again. I thought that it was referring only to that specific message. Since then, when I want to send a file even larger than the one that got the FILELINK  message before, I’m not getting the option to use FILELINK.   I believe that FILELINK is a useful tool. What do I need to do to get it back?

Thanks for your help, SweetTasha
creator: sweettasha

title: Syncing Tbird with iCloud contacts
content: Contacts syncing Tbird and iCloud appears to be unidirectional: Tbird > iCloud. When I make a change in Tbird contacts (via CardDAV), it appears in iCloud, but changes in iCloud do not effect Tbird contacts. Is this by design? Calendar sync is bidirectional.
